Short Explanation: The requirements placed on an individual employee to perform the work of his position to the satisfaction of his/her superior.
Does or performs something; plays the part of; carries out an action; produces as an effect; discharges are performs the office or duties or; serves in the capacity of.
To modify or change to fit specific or new situations.
Manage or direct. (Generally requires some additional explanation to show specific details. See also manage)
Create general and specific demand and acceptance for the company's products through use of indirect media such as displays in periodicals, or on posters, etc.
Offer an informed opinion or give specialized information to others.
Identify the elements of a whole and critically examine and relate these components separately and/or in relation to the whole.
Feels or realizes beforehand, foresees; looks forward to; expects acts in advance so as to prevent, preclude; to use in advance.
To assign or apportion for a specific purpose or to a particular person.
Judge as to quality; compare critically with established standards.
Exercise final and decisive authority, causing action to use money, manpower, materials, or equipment.
Type or kind, when used to define an action as in "area of responsibility."
Gather from various sources.

Help or aid others in the performance of work, where another employee assumes responsibility. Consists of performing portions of assigned work or carrying out details or the total assignment under the guidance of another. (Requires further explanation to show specific details.)
Specify or designate tasks and duties to be performed by others.
Makes sure of something; makes a doubtful thing certain; makes secure.
Is present at, remains, finds oneself at.
Examines to verify accuracy or conformity with requirements/policy.
The right to make decisions binding the individual, organizational unit, or company to a policy or course of action.
Approve or commit; an act implying subsequent action by others.
Statement of the estimated expenditures required for a program of action.
Make mathematical computations.
Aggregate sum of money, material, and land used to produce income in contrast to income received.
To arrange or organize individual positions according to the University of California classification specifications. Typically applies to PSS and positions covered by an employee bargaining unit.
Indicates the incumbent is assigned duties according to specified procedures and work is checked frequently.
Process of relating thoughts and knowledge, and applying them to solve problems. (Includes both knowledge and judgment.)
Pledge or assign to a particular course of action.
Convey information to others, ensuring that the information is received and understood.
Put together information or assemble data in a new form.
Manage or carry on, with an emphasis on the concept of immediate supervision of the task or activity, or personal leadership, e.g. conduct negotiations with union representatives.
Seeks opinion or advice of another.

Related to collective bargaining unit representation. If a position has access to or impact on information or negotiations affecting the wages, hours, and terms and conditions of employment for employees covered by recognized exclusive bargaining representatives, e.g. AFSCME, PTA.
Direct, regulate, or guide the use of money, methods, equipment, materials, etc. Also, the process of monitoring activities to ensure conformance with planned results.
Exercise restraining or governing influence over activities to accomplish planned results.
Act jointly with others.
Regulate, adjust, or direct the related actions of others in order to attain desired results.
Communicate in writing with individuals.
Gives advice and guidance to another.
Produce through imaginative skill.
The skill or ability to generate new and beneficial ideas.
Aid customers in the proper, economical, and effective use of energy; investigate and recommend or take action on customer complaints and inquiries.

Entrust to another person tasks or duties which require exercise of some of the authority of the person originally responsible, as "to delegate an administrative assistant to represent the department at conferences".

Devise and execute drawings or diagrams showing the features of an object, arrangement, or procedure. Does not include preparation of specifications or detailed instructions. Frequently, the function of designing is shared with others, in which case it is more precise to use design as a noun and state a job's function in relation thereto, i.e., originate, analyze, endorse, approve, etc., the design of .....
Create, disclose, discover, perfect, or unfold a plan or idea, in detail, gradually. Implies study and/or experiment unless otherwise stated. When used as "to develop subordinates," see train.
Form in the mind by combinations of ideas, new applications of principles, or new arrangements of parts.
Set limits to; bound or define; settle conclusively.
Govern or control work operations by establishing and implementing objectives, practices, and methods.

Indicates that the incumbent establishes procedures for attaining specific goals and objectives in a broad area of work. Only the final results of work done are typically reviewed. Incumbent typically develops procedures within the limit of established policy guidelines.
A physical or mental impairment that substantially limits one or more of an individual's major life activities; a record of such an impairment; or being regarded as having such an impairment.
Ensure an individual's or group's adherence to rules and regulations and penalize them for actions contrary to such rules and regulations.
Branch of education, activity, or interest embodying laws or rules, a set of facts, principles, and theories.
Latitude or freedom of choice within certain bounds.
Sell or otherwise get rid of materials, buildings, equipment, records, etc., which are of no further use to the company, including salvaging any usable material prior to disposal.
Deliver documents, equipment, tools, records, etc., to their proper destinations by mail or personal delivery.
Add support to recommendations of others. Implies a willingness to have one's name associated with a proposal or action of another.
Fabricated or assembled material in such form as to provide tools and machines with which people work.
Alike in significance; virtually the same. Implies independent study but may be achieved by constructive, relevant experience.
The fundamental (as opposed to marginal) job duty of the position the individual holds or desires.
Make stable or firm; settle or appoint permanently.
Forecast future quantities, values, sizes, extents, etc., either on the basis of judgment or calculation.
The approximation or appraisal of the value, cost, materials, staff, etc. of a program, plan, project, etc.
Ascertain or fix the value or worth of; examine, judge, appraise, or estimate.
Inspect or scrutinize in detail.
Put into effect or carry out methods, plans, etc.
Speed up the process of; helps along; assist and facilitate.
Branch of education, activity, or interest, sometimes referred to as a discipline, embodying laws or rules, a set of facts, principles, and theories.
Arrange records in a methodical manner for preservation and reference.
A device (such as folders or cabinet) by means of which documents are kept in order; a collection of related data records. May be automated or hard copy.
Current prediction of future events based on specified assumptions.
Create; make; evolve; elaborate; construct; builds.
Typically refers to an activity or area of responsibility, such as plant accounting, planning, analysis, administrative or clerical support, etc.
Broad qualitative statement describing a fundamental aim of the organization.

Indicates that the incumbent receives guidance in terms of broad goals and overall objectives, and is responsible for establishing the methods to attain them. Generally, the incumbent is in charge of an area of work and typically formulates policy for this area but does not necessarily have final authority for approving policy.
Indicates the incumbent develops procedures for the performance of a variety of duties; or performs complex duties within established policy guidelines.
Lead, step by step.

The salary range that a PSS or MSP position is assigned to. To assign a position to a salary range/grade based on evaluation factors rather than classification specifications. Used for MSP & SMG positions.
Carry out or fulfill by taking action.
Make better.
Communicate knowledge to others.
Set in motion or introduce.
Energy or foresight displayed by taking action without being specifically told to.
Control over an employee's work assignment, exercised while the work is being accomplished.
Examine materials, equipment, reports, work, etc., to determine quality, suitability for use, etc.
Teach, demonstrate, or by other methods impart knowledge to others by means of training courses. Direct that a specific activity be performed; may include directing how it is to be performed.
Combine into a whole.
Explain to others (orally or in writing) the meaning or significance of something.
Question and converse with another person in order to obtain facts or opinions.
Uncover facts by systematically finding them, conducting a searching inquiry, and examining various sources.
Mastery of a field and a thorough understanding of the application of the pertinent principles; also use or mastery of a field plus a thorough understanding of a specialized area of the field.
Understanding of the elementary principles of a field.
Mastery of the principles of a field.
A "talking" acquaintance with and understanding of the principles of a field.
Mastery of the entire field.
Lead workers do not have full supervisory authority but are able to schedule and control the daily working arrangements for a group of employees. Not interchangeable with “supervisor”.
Positions and personnel involved directly in executing the work for which the organization was created.
Keep is satisfactory condition.
Functions such as caring for oneself, performing manual tasks, walking, seeing, hearing, speaking, breathing, learning, and working.
Plan, organize, direct, control, and evaluate the operation of an organizational unit, with responsibility for the output.
Substances worked upon, used up, or gradually exhausted.
Way, technique, or process for doing something.
Keep track of, regulate, or control the operation of.
Inspire and stimulate others to maximize their performance and productivity.
Confer with others to reach an agreement.
Stated goal of the company or organization or individual.
Use equipment or systems for the purpose for which they were intended.
Structural or functional entity; may be the entire body of a company or the whole of a subdivision of a company.
Begin or initiate.
Supervise a function or operation as distinct from supervising people.

Any physiological disorder, or condition, cosmetic disfigurement, or anatomical loss affecting one or more of the following body systems: neurological, musculoskeletal, special sense organs, respiratory (including speech organs), cardiovascular, reproductive, digestive, genito-urinary, hemic and lymphatic, skin, and endocrine; or any mental or psychological disorder, such as mental retardation, organic brain syndrome, emotional or mental illness, and specific learning disabilities.
Locate and choose positions for personnel, equipment, or materials.
Written document that outlines the results of planning, usually quantitative, so future programs can be measured and compared with a series of reference points.
Organized process of devising a plan.

Broad, generalized statement of administrative or management action to be used as a guide or basis for establishing regulations, standards, and practices necessary for effective and efficient operation or conduct of business.
Specific detailed statement of a method of doing work repeatedly or habitually.
One who performs with proficiency in a given field of knowledge or profession.
Non-specific term that should be followed with the word “by” and then a description of the specifics.
Control over an employee's work, exercised prior to its start.
Established sequence of steps or actions to carry out a task.
Advance employees to higher positions; advance or foster ideas; or encourage the use of company equipment or services.
Recommend or suggest for consideration or adoption.
Commit the use of company funds for a specific purpose, whether by oral or written contract or by the exchange of money for goods or services.

The personal and professional attributes, including the skill, experience, education, physical, mental, safety, and other job-related requirements established by the employer as requirements which an individual must meet in order to be eligible for the position held or desired. Qualification standards may include a requirement that an individual not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of the individual or others. Essential Qualification Standards include the minimum qualifications necessary to perform the essential job functions. Non-Essential Standards include qualifications other than those required to effectively and safely perform the essential job functions.

An individual with a disability (1) who satisfies the requisite skill, experience, education, and other job-related requirements of the position such individual holds or desires; and (2) who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of that position.

Any modification or adjustment to a job application process that enables a qualified individual with a disability to be considered for the position the qualified individual desires; or any modification or adjustment to the work environment or to the manner or circumstances under which the position held or desired is customarily performed, that enables an applicant or employee to perform the essential functions of the position.
Present a matter to another person for action or approval.
Stand for, symbolize, portray, depict.

Specific inquiry involving prolonged and critical investigation, having for its aim the study of new facts and their interpretation, the revision of accepted conclusions or theories that may be affected by newly discovered facts, or the practical application of such new or revised conclusions. Example: Technical research to develop new products for the company.
Accountability to some higher authority for certain activities in a given sphere and for a given time.
Consider or examine facts or results for accuracy, completeness, and suitability.
Prepare a newly edited version of; changes or modify.
Range of activity or study.
Choosing from among qualified applicants the person or persons who best meet the selection criteria for the position available.

An employee in a position that is responsible for the actual selling of goods, services, or ideas, either directly to the public or through designated representatives. (Use only for positions that are primarily sales in nature and not for sales-oriented positions in a marketing, advertising or public relations field.)
Activities performed for others, usually involving some degree of physical effort or active contact with others.
Distribute in or to shares.
A condition of not having a sufficient amount.
Ask for and obtain; seek to persuade; entreat or importune.
Broad field of work study or professional interest.
Level of work experience typically required for the position in question, focusing on specific skills, techniques, procedures, or methods used in a field or occupation.
A group of employees.
A criterion used in appraising quality, quantity, or cost.
Encourage activity; promote development; set in motion.
Process of determining a company's long-term goals and then identifying the best approach for achieving those goals.
Plan and direct the work of employees, make decisions on work problems, instruct and train subordinates, check work in progress, and review completed work.
Work assignment to be completed in a specific amount of time.
Assist or help.
Help others acquire knowledge and skill by means of directed instruction.
Method of doing a specific task.
End the employment or association of an employee with the company.
Business event occurring at a particular point in time.
Teach a specified skill or type of behavior through practice and instruction over a period of time.
Move personnel, materials, or equipment from one place to another.
Provide worth or significance to.
Prove the truth by presentation of evidence; confirm.

Career paths summarize generic job profiles of a similar nature of contribution to the organization across different levels. E.g., all generic job profiles with management focus can be summarized under the management career path for different levels, all generic job profiles with technical and production focus can be summarized under the operations career path for different levels.
Describes the Generic Job, including the job family, roles, grade & grade differentiators.  It is aimed to include education & experience, competences & skills.
Groups of positions with the same or very similar areas of responsibilities, activities and requirement profiles.
Describes the individual position.
Code assigned to a Generic Job (would be also reflected in HRIS)
Job families result from the clustering of job sub-families with similar content regarding the tasks and activities.
Specific occurrence of a job or role in the organization
Job Sub-families result from the clustering of similar Generic Jobs with similar content regarding the tasks and activities.
Library containing all the Generic Jobs in the organization, and it will be linked to the Generic Job Profiles.
Finding the right place for a position in the job architecture, based on Job-Family, Job-Subfamily, Generic Job Profile and the right career path & level.
